body: Currently tox-boostrapd binds itself to all interfaces. I've got several IPs on server and I would like to run tox-boostrapd on port 443, but only on one of the IP addreses. There should be an option to allow binding to specific IPv4/IPv6 address(es).

comment_data.body: @nurupo assigning to you for triage. The preliminary target is for v0.0.5, but you can change that.

@iphydf tox-boostrapd doesn't bind to any port directly, it just uses toxcore, so this is a toxcore change. Once toxcore supports binding to different network interfaces, I can provide an option for that in tox-bootstrapd.

I moved this to v0.2.0, this will be a network change that's likely to be very important to clients. So it needs to be in minor version, v0.1 is not a candidate because it's fast approaching, and this is a network change so I don't want to introduce more bugs until after the api is ~stable.
Also, for anyone interested in adding code. Windows can't bind to a net-device or interface, so I'm very interested in seeing any solution.
Related to https://github.com/TokTok/c-toxcore/issues/221 , which is related to a qTox and irungentoo/toxcore issues mentioned in there.

title: Add option to allow binding tox-bootstrapd to specific IPs
